description: A former lawyer and justice minister under President François Mitterrand, he was an impassioned champion of human rights.
title: Robert Badinter, who helped abolish death penalty in France, dies at 95

description: Israel’s army described the overnight attacks as cover for a mission to rescue hostages, but the operation came at massive human cost. At least 67 people were killed.
title: Panic mounts in Rafah over looming Israeli offensive after night strikes

description: Dozens more were injured or missing after the landslide in Davao de Oro province that was one of the deadliest to hit the southern Philippines in recent years.
title: 55 dead in Philippines landslide that buried a village

description: The question now is how the establishment will respond to their unprecedented failure to politically sideline the party: More crackdowns on Khan and his allies or by trying to reconcile with the ex-premier?
title: After Pakistan’s shocking election result, all eyes are on the generals

description: The rescue was accomplished against the backdrop of airstrikes that killed dozens in densely populated Rafah, which is bracing for a full Israeli assault.
title: Israeli army rescues two hostages amid deadly airstrikes on Rafah

description: Israel’s military carried out airstrikes in the southern Gaza city, providing cover for the rescue of two hostages: Fernando Simon Marman, 60, and Luis Har, 70.
title: Middle East conflict live updates: Israel rescues two hostages amid strikes on Rafah

description: An Israeli filmmaker and a young mother in Gaza formed a rare friendship. The horrors of Oct. 7 and the conflict in Gaza brought them closer.
title: A bond unbroken: An Israeli and a Gazan find comfort in friendship

description: Kiptum’s Chicago marathon time of 2 hours 35 seconds broke the world record last year. His coach, Gervais Hakizimana, was also killed in the crash in Kenya.
title: Marathon world record holder Kelvin Kiptum dies in car crash at 24
